intro: Rhinanthus grandiflorus subsp. bosniacus, commonly known as the Bosnian yellowrocket, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic nature and lack of chlorophyll. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and forest edges. Its subspecific classification highlights its distinct genetic and morphological characteristics compared to other members of the Rhinanthus genus.
